item.title: RuneTek 4-5 Music Format
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:8, topic:424615”]Instead of this int noteOnOpcodes = 0; int noteOffOpcodes = 0; int wheelChangeOpcodes = 0; int chnnlAfterTchOpcodes = 0; int keyAfterTchOpcodes = 0; int progmChangeOpcodes = 0;

Why don’t you use int noteOnOpcodes, progmChangeOpcodes, noteOffOpcodes, wheelChangeOpcodes, chnnlAfterTchOpcodes, keyAfterTchOpcodes = 0;

Theres no reason to do this.

int i_35_ = 0; int i_36_ = 0; int i_37_ = 0; int i_38_ = 0; int i_39_ = 0; int i_40_ = 0; int i_41_ = 0; int i_42_ = 0; int i_43_ = 0; int i_44_ = 0;[/quote]
only keyAfterTchOpcodes is initialized to zero in that m8

Read full topic

item.title: RuneTek 4-5 Music Format
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

mykrominre:

what do I set ‘in’ as?

Doesn’t really matter but the ‘in’ referenced in the context of the code snippet was a modern jagex client byte buffer. Could use the java.nio.ByteBuffer package but you’d have to write a couple methods for it to work.

Read full topic

item.title: RuneTek 4-5 Music Format
item.dc:creator: @Pure_Slay Pure Slay
item.description:
@Pure_Slay wrote:

[quote=“sinisoul, post:19, topic:424615”][quote author=Owner Fritz link=topic=527273.msg3884794#msg3884794 date=1326340555]

[quote author=the elve age link=topic=527273.msg3848262#msg3848262 date=1323811606]Why don’t you use int noteOnOpcodes, progmChangeOpcodes, noteOffOpcodes, wheelChangeOpcodes, chnnlAfterTchOpcodes, keyAfterTchOpcodes = 0;

You’ll still need to initialize each variable, not just the last one.
[/quote]Ha my “programming” skills are turrrrible, does the “= 0;” not define for each individual variable?
[/quote]Correct. They do this to allow you to initialize different values on the same line. Personally this is why I prefer not to define more than one variable on one line.

Doesn’t matter with integers anyway.

All the variables will be set to 0 by default. You don’t have to manually initialize them (unless they are final).

If those are local variables, you’ll need to give them initial values before trying to use them. Fields, on the other hand, will be automatically initialized for you.

Conventions state that each variable should be initialized on its own line. Easier to read.

Personal preference. I can write all my variables as:

int PENIS_read = 0, PENIS_wrote = 0;

or

int PENIS_read = 0;
int PENIS_wrote = 0;

It really doesn’t matter. Conventions are not laws, they are just guidelines that one can interpret for their own personal style.[/quote]

Conventions are similar to grammar in English. It is a guideline system on how programmers deemed code to look and to be written by. Such as you notice when someone uses horrible grammar, using poor conventions does not help your case. Your only errors with conventions should be out of the lack of understanding or knowledge on that particular rule, not on your ignorance to accept them.

I wasn’t speaking to you stating you don’t follow conventions, as we both know that you do. Just the portion on personal style I don’t exactly agree with. You can have lee-way in naming but for the rules, sticking to the book as much as possible is a good idea and practice.

Read full topic

Doesn’t matter with integers anyway.

All the variables will be set to 0 by default. You don’t have to manually initialize them (unless they are final).

If those are local variables, you’ll need to give them initial values before trying to use them. Fields, on the other hand, will be automatically initialized for you.

Conventions state that each variable should be initialized on its own line. Easier to read.[/quote]

Personal preference. I can write all my variables as:

int PENIS_read = 0, PENIS_wrote = 0;

or

int PENIS_read = 0;
int PENIS_wrote = 0;

It really doesn’t matter. Conventions are not laws, they are just guidelines that one can interpret for their own personal style.

item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“imsuperman05, post:16, topic:424615”]Lmao why are you all going on about initializing variables… it’s the basics of Java…

i think its kinda funny hehe

OT: What is this :o, sounds for client?[/quote]

At first I was like okay, but then David came in and opened his mouth and I was like why?

Musics for the client. This is a sort of MIDI compression algorithm.

item.title: RuneTek 4-5 Music Format
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

[quote=“sinisoul, post:9, topic:424615”][quote author=the elve age link=topic=527273.msg3848262#msg3848262 date=1323811606]
Instead of this int noteOnOpcodes = 0; int noteOffOpcodes = 0; int wheelChangeOpcodes = 0; int chnnlAfterTchOpcodes = 0; int keyAfterTchOpcodes = 0; int progmChangeOpcodes = 0;

Why don’t you use int noteOnOpcodes, progmChangeOpcodes, noteOffOpcodes, wheelChangeOpcodes, chnnlAfterTchOpcodes, keyAfterTchOpcodes = 0;

Theres no reason to do this.

int i_35_ = 0; int i_36_ = 0; int i_37_ = 0; int i_38_ = 0; int i_39_ = 0; int i_40_ = 0; int i_41_ = 0; int i_42_ = 0; int i_43_ = 0; int i_44_ = 0;
[/quote]

Its preference, not a law. Also I find it easier to add comments to individual variables than ones with no grouping, such as I only ground coordinate variables together with other coordinate variables.[/quote]Just looks uglier, but its all about a person’s perspective

Read full topic

item.title: RuneTek 4-5 Music Format
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:8, topic:424615”]Instead of this int noteOnOpcodes = 0; int noteOffOpcodes = 0; int wheelChangeOpcodes = 0; int chnnlAfterTchOpcodes = 0; int keyAfterTchOpcodes = 0; int progmChangeOpcodes = 0;

Why don’t you use int noteOnOpcodes, progmChangeOpcodes, noteOffOpcodes, wheelChangeOpcodes, chnnlAfterTchOpcodes, keyAfterTchOpcodes = 0;

Theres no reason to do this.

int i_35_ = 0; int i_36_ = 0; int i_37_ = 0; int i_38_ = 0; int i_39_ = 0; int i_40_ = 0; int i_41_ = 0; int i_42_ = 0; int i_43_ = 0; int i_44_ = 0;[/quote]

Its preference, not a law. Also I find it easier to add comments to individual variables than ones with no grouping, such as I only ground coordinate variables together with other coordinate variables.

Read full topic
